Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Mark Warner's role as the "tiebreaking vote" to pass Obamacare. While his vote was crucial, there were 59 other senators who also voted to end the debate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to definitively state that Mark Warner's vote was the tiebreaking vote. Other Democratic senators have also been accused of casting the deciding vote.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the passage of Obamacare, as other Democratic senators have also been accused of casting the deciding vote.
